oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Total Synthesis of Both Spiroketal Diastereomers of the Reported Structure of Cephalosporolide H
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: FERNANDES, RA
HALLE, MB
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: asymmetric dihydroxylation
cephalosporolides
cross metathesis
Keck's allylation
spiroketalization
OLEFIN CROSS-METATHESIS
MARINE-DERIVED FUNGUS
CATALYTIC ASYMMETRIC ALLYLATION
PENICILLIUM-SP
LACTONES
ALDEHYDES
SPONGE
WATER
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A total synthesis of both spiroketal diastereomers of the reported structure of cephalosporolide H is accomplished in 12 steps and 9% overall yield. The key steps involve Keck's allylation, cross metathesis (to get the desired beta,gamma-unsaturated ester), Sharpless asymmetric dihydroxylation (to install the eta-hydroxy-gamma-lactone moiety), and spiroketalization to access both spiroketal diastereomers of the reported structure of the natural product.
